Class ActionLogicBlock

  • java.lang.Object
    • LogicBlock
      • ActionLogicBlock

  • public class ActionLogicBlock
extends LogicBlock
    An ActionLogicBlock is a LogicBlock that represents an action that should occur in the system when the appropriate triggers have occurred.

    Each ActionLogicBlock consists of the Peripheral on which the action should occur and the actionString that represents the action on the Peripheral.

    When the update method of this ActionLogicBlock is called, if the callerOutput field is true then the doAction method of the peripheral will be called and the action represented by actionString will be executed by the peripheral.

    The nextBlocks list of an ActionLogicBlock is always empty since an action represents the completion of a logical statement.

    The output value of an ActionLogicBlock is never updated because the output of an ActionLogicBlock is considered to be the execution of an action on a Peripheral.

    Author:
    Shawn Koop

      • addNextBlock

        public void addNextBlock(LogicBlock block)
        This method overrides the addNextBlock method in LogicBlock so that the method does nothing because ActionLogicBlock objects have no next blocks.

        The addNextBlock method of an ActionLogicBlock should never be called but this is implemented as a safeguard in case someone tries.

        Overrides:
        addNextBlock in class LogicBlock
        Parameters:
        block - This field is not used but is kept to override this method in LogicBlock.

      • update

        public void update(boolean callerOutput)
        When this method is called, if the callerOutput field is true then the doAction method of the peripheral will be called and the action represented by actionString will be executed by the peripheral.
        Specified by:
        update in class LogicBlock
        Parameters:
        callerOutput - The output value of the LogicBlock that called update on this LogicBlock.
